intro: Aquilegia platysepala, commonly known as the broad-sepal aquilegia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ranunculaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that come in a range of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. Its leaves are palmately compound, with five to seven leaflets that are deeply lobed. Aquilegia platysepala thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
